There is no such thing as a "limited" application to an Article V convention. There are no rules or guidelines in the U.S. Constitution. It could very well be a free for all where every American's rights are up for grabs. Most legal scholars agree w/ this.
#mapoli #MAleg

overall, @amprog estimates that if it is adopted nationwide, automatic voter registration could add over 22 MILLION new voters to the registration rolls. https://t.co/jO7xN9Ty80
@Taniel thread here: https://t.co/pz4lcJ0TZJ
In the first 6 months of Vermont's program, over 12,000 voters' registration records were updated thanks to the state's AVR law https://t.co/PmPfzBwW9S

This is a continuing trend of the success of automatic voter registration systems.
In the first 18 months of Oregon's motor voter program, the state added 375,000 new voters to the rolls. https://t.co/COUkqswVwt
Big news: California's new motor voter law (an automatic voter registration type law) registered 259,294 NEW voters in just the first 2.5 months of the program. https://t.co/qe3rrVRhtr
